class_notes: (This seminar-style course will examine classic systems of neuroethology, the neural basis of animal behavior, concentrating on sensory systems and predation/escape behaviors. Topics will include electrical senses and communication in fish, honeybee behavior, use of ultrasound to hunt (bats) and avoid being eaten (insects), owl hearing, and coevolution of neurotoxins for defense and offense. There will be a mix of background lectures and student presentations of research papers.)
course_description: Study of variable topics of special interest in neuroscience and behavioral biology. May be repeated for credit when topics vary.
sections: Class Nbr: 3282, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2:40-3:55p, Instructor: R. Wyttenbach, Status: Open
